title: Learn the Advantages of a Free Trial Unit | Salesforce Trailhead

questions.title: 1Why should you go to the trouble of offering a free trial of your product?

answers.content: B A trial helps your customers see what it's like to use your product, and it can also help internal teams do their work.

wrongAnswers.content: C If all of your competitors have free trials and you don't, no one will buy your product.
D Salesforce makes offering a free trial so easy, you might as well just flip the switch and do it.
A Offering a free trial is a standard practice in the software industry, and 'Try before you buy' is a proven sales approach.

correctAnswer.content: B A trial helps your customers see what it's like to use your product, and it can also help internal teams do their work.

questions.title: 2Your sales team is attending a warehouse industry trade show next week, and they want to show off your new Heavy Lifting product, which has a trial version. How can you help them make the best pitch?

answers.content: B Show your sales team how to install the free trial so that they can show attendees how to do it at the show.
C Create a trial org with data relevant to the warehouse industry, and make it available for your sales team to use in a demo.
D Offer a discount to prospects who agree to buy on the day of the show.

wrongAnswers.content: A Tell your sales team to send an email to attendees, showing them how to install your free trial before the show.

correctAnswer.content: C Create a trial org with data relevant to the warehouse industry, and make it available for your sales team to use in a demo.

questions.title: 3What should you consider when creating a trial for a specific customer?

answers.content: B Sample data that shows how your app meets customer needs

wrongAnswers.content: C Whether you should skip the trial and focus on other marketing approaches
